screen_desc: The screenshot shows a search interface for apps and games on a mobile device. The search bar is at the top, with a microphone icon for voice search. Below the search bar, there is a list of recently searched apps: Google Drive, Roku Remote, Truecaller, and Airtel Thanks app. Each app has an arrow next to it, possibly for quick access or to view more details. The layout appears to be part of a typical Android app store or app launcher interface.
history_actions: click on the "Play Store" icon located at the right and lower part of the screen.
click on the magnifying glass search icon located at the top-right corner.
click on the search bar located at the top right.

think_action.Thought: The user wants to uninstall the 'Lyft' app, but we are currently in the search interface of the Play Store. To proceed with the uninstallation, we need to locate the app's Play Store page. The next logical step is to type 'Lyft' into the search bar to find the app.
Future Action Plan: Select the 'Lyft' app from the search results.
Click the 'Uninstall' button on the app's page.
